articles.title: About
articles.contents:
About Me
I am Elif Kuyuk, a current junior at Bartlett High School. Among many
various hobbies, I enjoy hiking and gardening. Learning new things is
always a pleasure, especially if accompanied with friends.
Contact Information
Email: ekuyuk04@gmail.com
Github: https://github.com/ekuyuk
About the Project
This project briefly observes and analyzes what might be affecting a
students performance. Family life, genetics, environmental cues; these
all play a big role in a students success. Finding out the main factors,
and potentially inspiring us students to beneficially work with such
factors, is the main goal.
Goals
Comparing genetic factors (race, gender)
Analyzing individual factors (study session before test, lunch
type)
Finding out the main factor affecting a students behavior from the
factors included in the data set.
Obstacles: Expected
Organizing the data, finding out the best way to correctly visualize
the patterns.
Column/row management and graphing
““This is Data Science””
~ Preceptor

articles.title: Student Performance
articles.description:
The success of a student relies on many different factors; knowing how to 
handle and control these factors will increase a students performance.
articles.contents:
A students success and beneficial academic performance depends on
various factors. The following data was pulled from Kaggle. Graphs were
used to represent the correlation between test scores and parental level
of education, lunch type, race, test preparation, and gender. Students
that were not taking a free/reduced lunch, had taken the preparation
course, and had parents with an education level above high school were
observed to have higher scores.



In most parental levels of education, male students seem to be
receiving higher math scores; distribution of scores for students
receiving a standard lunch is higher.
The sample size of each level of education could change
interpretation, therefore:

articles.title: Overview
articles.contents:
A Quick Glance
A persons character, personality, all morph and set whilst their in
school. Their teachers, the environment they’re in, the academic
feedback they receive; all set the stones for the path they will pursue
in life. In most scenarios, higher academic performance leads to higher
satisfaction in the career they pursue.
Using data from Kaggle, 4 different factors were observed.
Ethnicity
Gender
Parental Level of Education
Lunch Type
These factors were then compared with reading, writing, and math
scores.
Summary
Racially/Ethnically: Groups C and D had higher averages
compared to other groups.
Test Preparation Course: It was very blunt and clear that
students who took the course recieved higher scores than students who
did not.
Standard Lunch & Free and Reduced Lunch: Students
recieving a standard lunch could be seen doing better across all three
subjects, no matter the race or parental level of education.
Parental Level of Education: Students with parents of some
high school education were, in most categories, recieving lower scores
compared to the rest. Students that had parents with an education level
above high school were observed to have higher scores.
Possible Application
To potentially increase test scores, families and schools can aim to
provide all students with a standard lunch.
Lower education costs would encourage many to continue with their
education.
Those that do attain certain degrees show care for education and
their life; this reflects on their children, who also see education of
equal worth, if nor more. Of course, there are many families with
parents of minimal education, and children of extreme determination and
self-respect.

Further Studies can be conducted to understand which learning method
biologically works better for each gender, which could improve the low
scores of females in certain categories (this would also apply to male
students in low-score clusters.)
Education is how the culture of a generation is set; its value needs
to be comprehended by all for an ignorance-free society.

articles.title: Sources
articles.contents:
Data:
Data “Students Performances in Exams” was originally composed by
JAKKI SESHAPANPU, which was last updated 4 years ago.
Link: https://www.kaggle.com/datasets/spscientist/students-performance-in-exams?resource=download
